definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: Fiesco, set free, encounters Paolo on his way to execution.
sentences.chinese: 菲耶斯科獲釋，並在與被押赴刑場的保羅在路上相遇。

sentences.english: Next day when I go to the execution ground, mother hopes you will not watery.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，當我去刑場，媽媽希望你不會流淚。

sentences.english: On the execution ground, gowardesh chip finally won the vitality for the treasure.
sentences.chinese: 刑場上，狗娃以寶藏爲籌碼終於獲得了生機。

sentences.english: Haikou Intermediate People's Court sentenced the end, Dong Lin was escorted to an execution ground.
sentences.chinese: 海口中院公判會結束後，董林被押赴刑場執行死刑。

sentences.english: Chinese execution ground you stand on the first few rows?
sentences.chinese: 中國人，刑場上你站在第幾排？

sentences.english: A death sentence may be executed on the execution ground or in a designated place of custody.
sentences.chinese: 死刑可以在刑場或者指定的羈押場所內執行。

sentences.english: Very soon, he was brought to the execution ground and shot.
sentences.chinese: 很快的，他就被帶上刑場槍斃。

sentences.english: Wang Erni and all students to the execution ground.
sentences.chinese: 王二妮和所有學員都到了刑場。

sentences.english: The road to the firing squad is their path of glory.
sentences.chinese: 通向死刑場之路便是他們的光榮之路。

definition: abbr. for 勞動改造|劳动改造[lao2 dong4 gai3 zao4]/reform through labor/laogai (prison camp)
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
